com.intel.fightclub.dialog

Class DialogContextCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.fightclub.dialog.DialogContextCreator

  • @NotThreadSafe
public final class DialogContextCreator
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to create dialogue's context when initializing it. This is basically a builder aimed at defining all options when initializing dialog with a specific context. The purpose of this class is to also constraint this

      • setConversationalGapMillis

        @NonNull
public DialogContextCreator setConversationalGapMillis(long gapMillis)
        Sets the conversational gap in millis. This is useful to make the dialog engine to pause for a moment before each systemOutput, in order to give the user a chance to interject a question or whatever.
        Parameters:
        gapMillis - Conversational gap between to system output calls, in millis.
        Returns:
        The instance of this creator, to append more setter calls.

        Returns:

      • create

        @NonNull
public com.intel.ndg.sdi.cap.common.ValueMap create()
        Creates the resulting dialog context as a ValueMap, as expected by dialog. This method will validate that the context contains the minimum amount of information required by dialogue.
        Returns:
        The ValueMap containing all contextual information required at startup.
